did.unittitle: UW-Milwaukee University Communications & Media Relations Photographs, circa 1900-2014

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee. University Communications & Media Relations

extref.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department

did.abstract: Photographic prints, negatives, slides, and digital images pertaining to the activities of the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee (UWM) and its predecessors compiled or created by the office of University Communications & Media Relations. The photographs were created primarily to illustrate the publications of University Communications & Media Relations dating from 1989 to 2014. The collection includes photographs of prominent visitors to campus; accomplished faculty members, students, and alumni; student activities, including the arts, athletic events, and commencement ceremonies; and activities of senior officials from the UWM administration. The collection also includes photographs that document the campuses of UWM and its predecessor institutions, as well as the city of Milwaukee, from circa 1900 to 1986.

bioghist.p: The Milwaukee State Teachers College's Publicity Department became the News Bureau by 1952 and the News Services Office in 1953. After the creation of UWM, the Office of News Services was created in 1957 and later placed under the authority of the Assistant Chancellor of University Relations. It was called News Service (1957-1970), News and Publications (1971-1977), Office of News Services (1978-1986), News Services and Publications (1987-1999), and University Communications & Media Relations (2000-present). The office produces news articles, publications, web content and marketing materials on university events, people, achievements and priorities. Publications include UWM Report (1978-2014), UWM Today (1988-2013), and Kenwood (1983-1988).

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photographic prints, negatives, slides, and digital images pertaining to the activities of UWM and its predecessors compiled or created by University Communications & Media Relations. The majority of the photographs were taken during the daily activities of publishing the UWM Report and UWM Today (the magazine of the UWM Alumni Association, renamed UWM Alumni in 2013). The photographs primarily provide a chronological record of the university and the greater Milwaukee community between 1987 and 1986. Some of the photographs in the collection were compiled between circa 1900 and 1986, but appear to have been used for features in the publications produced during the bulk date period.

The collection documents university communications regarding such topics as UWM buildings, administrative changes, student activities, athletics, campus events, minority student groups, faculty and student research, alumni accomplishments, and the university's involvement in world affairs. It includes photographs of prominent visitors to campus from 2000 to 2014, including politicians, academics, and authors; photographs of campus buildings; portraits of accomplished faculty members, students, and alumni; snapshots of daily life and student activities on campus, including the arts, athletic events, and commencement ceremonies; and photographs of activities of senior officials from the UWM administration.

arrangement.p: This collection was received in, and is organized in, multiple parts. Additional materials have not been physically arranged and interfiled, and researchers may need to consult more than one part of the collection to locate similar materials.
The records are arranged into the following series:
The files in series 1 and 3 are organized alphabetically by folder heading within each series. Files in series 2 are organized approximately reverse-chronologically by date of event.

otherfindaid.p: A spreadsheet with file-level information on the electronic records is available in the Archives department. The spreadsheet contains information on photographer, copyright status, date of creation of digital image, limited description of photo content, image size, file format, file size, and software used to create the files. Additional technical metadata is available; see an archivist for details.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material in the UWM Libraries

archref.unittitle: UW-Milwaukee University Communications & Media Relations Records

accessrestrict.p: Electronic records must be accessed in the Archives reading room, and researchers must use access copies of electronic records. There are no other access restrictions on the materials, and the collection is open to all members of the public in accordance with state law.

userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of libel, privacy, and copyright which may be involved in the use of this collection (Wisconsin Statutes 19.21-19.39).

acqinfo.p: University Communications & Media Relations transferred the collection (accession 2006-069) in June 2006. University Communications donated additional materials in August 2014 (accession 2014-028) and May 2016 (accession 2015-045).

processinfo.p: Michelle Caswell processed the collection at the Archives from January through April 2008 (Brad Houston supervised).
In January 2012, Bob Jaeger removed 65 safety film negatives and placed them with other safety film negatives.
In August 2015, Ashlie Biddle processed accession 2014-028 (Brad Houston supervised).
In November 2016, Ashlie Biddle processed accession 2015-045 (Brad Houston supervised).

processinfo.head: Preservation Information
processinfo.p: During processing of the original collection, digital images originally received on CDs were copied to network storage and reformatted from .jpg to .tif format. This file format serves as the preservation master. Access copies in .jpg format were also copied to network storage. The original CDs were then discarded.

During processing of accession 2014-028, digital files originally received on CDs were copied to network storage and reformatted to various preservation formats (JPEG to TIFFs for images; EPS to PDF for Publisher Files; Word Documents to Open Document Text files for word processing files). A number of InDesign files were not added to the active collection but were preserved on network storage in the event that the archives are able to convert them at some later date.

During processing of accession 2015-045, digital files originally received on CDs were copied to network storage and reformatted to various preservation formats. Access copies in .jpg format were also copied to network storage. The original CDs were kept as back-up copies.

phystech.p: As of November 15, 2016, all electronic files were accessible on a Intel Core i5-4570 CPU (3.20 GHz, 4 GB RAM) running Windows 7 Enterprise, with Service Pack 1. Windows Picture and Fax Viewer and Adobe Acrobat were used to access the files.
The collection includes records in the following file formats:

scopecontent.p: Most of the photographs in this series were taken during the daily activities of publishing the UWM Report and UWM Today from 1989 to 2014. Photographs of interest from both the Report and Today include presidential candidates George W. Bush (2002) and John Kerry (2004), the Rube Goldberg Contest from the summer of 2002, Commencement photos from 2003-2006, Pantherfest, UWM Alumni Association event photos, Panther Prowl, and many UWM sports photographs including the men's basketball Sweet Sixteen trip (2005) and the Horizon League Tournament.

Also present are photographs from other university publications, such as the View Book, Kenwood, the UWM portion of The University of Wisconsin System Introduction, Panther Family News, Neighbor Notes, Fact Card, and a variety of brochures.

did.unittitle: Commemorative Booklet for John H. Schroeder, 1991-1998

scopecontent.p: Series 2 documents events on campus from 1965 to 2011. Noteworthy are photographs of prominent visitors to campus from 2000 to 2006 including Gloria Steinem, Ralph Nader, Michael Moore, Toni Morrison, Cornel West, Maya Angelou, and Alice Walker. The collection also includes a small number of photographs of Lady Bird Johnson during her 1965 visit to Milwaukee. Also included are photographs of student activities on campus, including the protests of 1970, athletic events (such as the trip of the men's basketball team to the NCAA Sweet Sixteen in 2005), and the inaugurations of Chancellor Nancy Zimpher in 1999 and Chancellor Michael R. Lovell in 2011.

scopecontent.p: Series 3 covers a variety of topics relating to campus life from circa 1900 to 2011. Highlights of the series include photographs of historic theaters in the Milwaukee area, UWM's involvement with the early years of the Peace Corps, the launch of the Milwaukee Idea initiative in 1998, and campus aerial shots, 1989-1998. The series also documents the development of campus, from its initial beginnings as Milwaukee Normal School in the "Old Main" building (now Mitchell Hall), to the construction of new administrative, classroom, library, athletic, and arts buildings during the 1960s and 1970s, through the dedication of the Zelazo Center for the Performing Arts in 2002.Images include those of prominent political figures who visited campus, including George W. Bush, and 2004 Democratic primary presidential hopefuls Dennis Kucinich and Howard Dean. Also included are photographs of commencement from 2004 to 20011, American Indian Awareness Days 2004, Pantherfest from 2003 to 2005, UWM events at Miller Park, and some men's and women's basketball games from 2003 to 2006.
